title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
anamarias left at 00:10 (Quit: anamarias

kibahop joined #xwiki at 08:25  
anna\_\_ joined #xwiki at 08:59  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:17  
bbc581 left at 09:35 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:39  
vmassol left at 09:44 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:46  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:46  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:46  
vmassol - (09:50): good morning everyone  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:58  
lucaa - (10:04): ah cool  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 10:08  
evalica joined #xwiki at 10:10  
vmassol - (10:13): lucaa: I'd rather not have to do this… I don't find it that cool :) however I'm giving a training and I have to understand it ;)  
plunden joined #xwiki at 10:19  
vmassol - (10:25): guys, is it correct to say that "dynamic custom mapping" is custom mapping resolved at runtime when you import a XAR containing classes with custom mapping defined?  
vmassol - (10:25): is it also correct to say that it's not in a working state and shouldn't be used?  
vmassol - (10:25): (I guess I should ask Ludovic)  
mariusbutuc joined #xwiki at 10:27  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 10:28  
kibahop left #xwiki at 10:36  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 10:36  
vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 10:41  
vmassol left at 10:43 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
silviar left at 10:53 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
silviar joined #xwiki at 10:58  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:00  
vmassol1 - (11:02): moving the custom mapping page from draft to platform....  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 11:03  
sdumitriu left at 11:05 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
Enygma` left at 11:09 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea - (11:13): Guys, we use JUnit 4.5 for enterprise tests. What stops us from upgrading to the latest stable version? (I found 4.8.1 in the maven central repo) I'm asking because I'd like to know the name of the current test method (this information was available in JUnit 3) and it seems this was (re)added since JUnit 4.7  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:14  
vmassol1 - (11:27): mflorea: +1 for the latest junit  
vmassol1 - (11:27): you can get the method name using a @Rule indeed  
bbc581 joined #xwiki at 11:34  
jvdrean left at 11:35 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 11:37  
mflorea left at 11:41 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol1 - (11:51): guys is there any reason for not replacing our HQL queries with XWQL queries everywhere?  
florinciu1 joined #xwiki at 11:51  
jvdrean left at 12:15 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:18  
anna\_\_ left at 12:22 (Quit: anna\_\_  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:46): Hello vmassol1 did you see my tutorial on dynamic custom mapping? My experience was that it works fine for loading and saving but sometimes using shorter queries fails because the mappings were not injected.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:53): Ahh, I guess you saw it seeing as you edited it.  
kibahop left at 13:02 (Remote host closed the connection  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:05): Committing more test framework changes...  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 13:11  
kibahop left #xwiki at 13:13  
anna\_ joined #xwiki at 13:22  
vmassol1 - (13:22): CalebJamesDeLisl: hi, yes I've found it. I didn't know about it but saw it while googling :)  
vmassol1 - (13:23): CalebJamesDeLisl: btw did you get dynamic custom mapping to work?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:23): Yes it works fine, IMO it is a very cool feature.  
vmassol1 - (13:23): I was under the impression that ludovic told me in the past that it wasn't finished.working  
vmassol1 - (13:23): ah ok  
vmassol1 - (13:23): in your tutorial there are a few places where you've put warnings that it doesn't work  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:24): My experience comes from writing the loader which had to implement these things.  
vmassol1 - (13:24): what loader?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:24): Implemented HibernateStore.loadXWikiDoc  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:25): I seem to recall 1000 times the speed on documents with >1000 objects attached.  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 13:26  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:26): Not committed because it's so hard to prove there would be no surprises.  
vmassol1 - (13:26): sorry my memory is hazy. You reimplemented loadXWikiDoc to handle objects in a bette way is that it?  
vmassol1 - (13:26): ok  
vmassol1 - (13:26): ok so indeed you had to understand this  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:27): Instead of getting the document then getting each object, it gets the document then queries for objects attaches to the doc.  
vmassol1 - (13:27): ok  
vmassol1 - (13:27): ludovic just told me that the pb with the dynamic custom mapping is that it's way less performant than static custom mapping  
vmassol1 - (13:28): because it forces the system to reinit the hibernate mapping  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:28): Then queries for props by object, something like "where prop.id in [big list of object ids]"  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:28): Yes that is what I saw. It injects new mappings on each document load.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:29): This is also why sometimes the queries don't work, the mapping hasn't been injected yet.  
vmassol1 - (13:31): k  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:32): Re tests: I couldn't make the framework work without page.gotoPage() pages in a lightbox have no URL so they can't be URL reachable.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:32): + pages which only show after a post.  
vmassol1 - (13:32): that's ok we don't need taht  
vmassol1 - (13:33): these tests can navigate  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:33): Also getCurrentPage is a big headache because every navigation would have to update it.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:34): I have put estUtils  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:34): T  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:34): \*TestUtils back but it's not all static anymore.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:35): I'm not sure if TestUtils should have access to the driver or should just return URLs which the test then feeds to driver.get  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:36): It holds a reference to the context and so has access to the driver for now. (local copy)  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 14:33  
mflorea - (14:39): CalebJamesDeLisl: is it possible to run only the ui-tests from a single test class, like we do for WYSIWYG tests with -Dpattern=LinkTest ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:39): Yup. -Dtest=  
vmassol1 - (14:40): mflorea: http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/single-test.html  
mflorea - (14:48): CalebJamesDeLisl, vmassol1: thanks  
vmassol1 is now known as vmassol ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:51): should we start importing org.xwiki.it.ui.elements.\*; for the tests? It would make them easier to write.  
mariusbutuc left at 14:52 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvdrean left at 14:53 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea - (14:54): CalebJamesDeLisl: I'm for importing only what is needed, even if that means a long list of imports (instead of .\*)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:55): For verbosity or for performance?  
vmassol - (14:55): actually nobody imports anything nowadays… it's done automatically by IDEs… :)  
vmassol - (14:55): so it doesn't matter if it's a 100 item list  
vmassol - (14:55): I also prefer to only import what's needed  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 14:57  
mflorea1 joined #xwiki at 14:57  
florinciu2 joined #xwiki at 14:57  
lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 14:58  
Enygma` left at 14:58 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
silviar1 joined #xwiki at 14:59  
evalica1 joined #xwiki at 14:59  
evalica left at 15:00 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
florinciu1 left at 15:00 (Ping timeout: 258 seconds  
mflorea left at 15:00 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
silviar left at 15:00 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
lucaa left at 15:01 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
lucaa1 - (15:02): hi team  
lucaa1 - (15:03): I know when you do  
lucaa1 - (15:03): xwiki.search("select d from XWikiDocument d, <etc>" )  
lucaa1 - (15:03): the xwiki documents fetched have no objects inside (because of the way mapping is done)  
lucaa1 - (15:03): is there a way to get the documents with the objects as well?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:04): HibernateStore loads the document then loads each object (and each property) and adds them to it.  
lucaa1 - (15:04): or if not, the "best-practice" is to search for the doc names and then do xwiki.getDocument() for the documents, right?  
vmassol - (15:06): lucaa1: depends what you're doing. You can do a single query if you're looking for specific objects I guess  
lucaa1 - (15:06): and how do I get objects with props inside?  
lucaa1 - (15:07): because xwiki.search("select o from BaseObject o <etc>") does the same, fetches without props  
vmassol - (15:07): props are in other tables  
vmassol - (15:07): see xwiki.hbm.xml  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:07): Unless they are custom mapped, you can't.  
lucaa1 - (15:07): yes I know, I was just wondering if we have a function with a param or some sort of something  
lucaa1 - (15:07): I know why I can't get them with a simple search  
arkub left at 15:08 (Quit: Leaving  
anna\_ left at 15:08 (Quit: anna\_  
vmassol - (15:11): CalebJamesDeLisl: is it not possible with a join between XWikiDocument, BaseObject and PropertyClass?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:12): Maybe. I think there will be issues with some of the property types which the tables are not known beforehand.  
arkub joined #xwiki at 15:12  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:13): EG: you don't know where a list will reside, maybe in LargeStrings, maybe in ListItems.  
vmassol - (15:14): this is deterministic no? Depending on the data type you use you know where it's located no?  
lucaa1 - (15:14): vmassol: I think you might need to go through com.xpn.xwiki.store.XWikiHibernateStore.loadXWikiDoc(XWikiDocument, XWikiContext) in order to get all objs et all, which I doubt it happens when you just select objects with hibernate  
vmassol - (15:14): lucaa1: as I said it depends what you want to do  
vmassol - (15:14): if you want to load all objects sure it's easier  
vmassol - (15:14): but if you only want to find values for some of them  
vmassol - (15:14): without loading them all  
vmassol - (15:14): then you need a direct query  
lucaa1 - (15:14): I want to load  
lucaa1 - (15:15): if you want props is simple you can just query for prop  
lucaa1 - (15:15): I want to make a regular hibernate request that returns instances (of XWikiDocument) in this case, but fully loaded  
lucaa1 - (15:15): fully loaded == with all objects & props inside  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:16): Re "this is deterministic": It depends on a property set in the class. A solution is to look for both.  
mflorea1 - (15:16): vmassol: is there a component in JIRA for enterprise tests? I couldn't find one at http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Acomponents-panel . I want to open a jira issue for upgrading JUnit in enterprise tests pom. 'Build  & Packaging' is the closest match.  
vmassol - (15:17): mflorea1: it's" build&packaging"  
mflorea1 - (15:17): ok, thanks  
vmassol - (15:17): it needs to be renamed  
vmassol - (15:17): to include tests  
vmassol - (15:17): I'll do it  
mflorea1 - (15:17): ok  
vmassol - (15:18): done  
vmassol - (15:18): renamed to "Build, Infrastructure and Tests"  
mflorea1 - (15:18): sounds good, thanks  
kibahop left #xwiki at 15:28  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 15:29  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 15:32  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:35): I'm going to deprecate HomePage.gotoHomePage in favor of HomePage.gotoPage. Sound good?  
vmassol - (15:36): I don't think this is enough  
vmassol - (15:37): as we discussed I think it's best to have a gotoPage method in AbstractTest  
jvdrean left at 15:37 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (15:37): but I haven't thought more about it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:37): How does it find pages which are not reachable by URL?  
vmassol - (15:37): (currently working on a training doc)  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 15:38  
vmassol - (15:38): I don't see any need for that and in any case it's the same  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:38): I think standardizing the term so we don't have gotoHomePage and gotoAdministrationPage can only help.  
jvdrean left at 15:38 (Client Quit  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:39): I spent a good part of Saturday trying to implement exactly what you said and concluded that it's impossible to do it well.  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 15:39  
jvdrean left at 15:46 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 15:47  
jvdrean left at 15:47 (Client Quit  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 15:47  
abusenius - (15:48): hi @all  
jvdrean left at 15:48 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
abusenius - (15:49): security mailing list is about to be created  
abusenius - (15:52): all core committers will be there by default, but we need more candidatures, any ideas?  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 15:52  
plunden left #xwiki at 15:54  
vmassol - (15:56): abusenius: wdym by "we need more"?  
vmassol - (15:56): abusenius: what we discussed I think  
vmassol - (15:56): is to update the contributing section of dev.xwiki.org  
vmassol - (15:56): to have a blurb about reporting security issues  
abusenius - (15:56): that of couse, yes  
vmassol - (15:57): I think our default strategy should be only committers on that list  
abusenius - (15:57): I mean other trusted persons who are not committers, but would be able to contribute to the discussion  
vmassol - (15:57): (except for you right now)  
abusenius - (15:57): they should go through a vote of course  
abusenius - (15:58): I mean if committers do not want anybody else to be there, thats fine :)  
mflorea1 - (15:58): CalebJamesDeLisl, vmassol: I'd like to write a selenium 2 test for create new page panel. I thought of adding a method to ViewPage to get the CreateNewPagePanel which extends BaseElement. WDYT? AFAICS there are no selenium 2 tests that involve the panels yet.  
vmassol - (15:58): abusenius: so all coommitters + you sounds good enough for now I think  
vmassol - (15:58): also this list should be listed in the MailingLists pagfe  
vmassol - (15:59): s/pagfe/page/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:59): mflorea1: That sounds correct.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:59): Interesting reading: http://www.apache.org/security/committers.html  
vmassol - (15:59): mflorea1: not sure I understand  
abusenius - (15:59): vmassol,  how about Raffaello Pelagalli and Andreas Jonsson  
abusenius - (15:59): ?  
vmassol - (15:59): "create new page panel" would add a panel on the right?  
vmassol - (16:00): abusenius: +1 for raffaello, he's stilla  committer afaik  
mflorea1 - (16:00): vmassol: no, suppose the panel is there, we need a method to access it  
abusenius - (16:01): vmassol, he is not in the list of committers  
mflorea1 - (16:01): editPage = viewPage.getCreateNewPagePanel().createNewPage(spaceName, pageName)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:01): Maybe return a "right panels" object?  
abusenius - (16:01): well, thats why I asked for candidatures?  
abusenius - (16:01): s/?//  
vmassol - (16:01): abusenius: Raffaello is ok IMO  
vmassol - (16:02): re Andreas, I don't know, others should know better, I haven't followed too closely his implication wrt security in xwiki  
abusenius - (16:02): anybody else who you wouldn't be -1 for?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:02): It seems to me that people who want access and don't appear suspicious should have it, we're not a secret society.  
vmassol - (16:03): CalebJamesDeLisl: how do you qualify "suspicious"?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:03): Shows up one day, asks for access.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:04): Anyone who has interacted in the community and has done some work on the code is obviously (to me) not a spy.  
vmassol - (16:04): it's not about spy  
vmassol - (16:04): it's about the person understanding security and not blogging about it, etc  
abusenius - (16:04): giving access to security mailing list to anyone who asks is not very secure :)  
vmassol - (16:04): otherwise there's no point in having such a list IMO  
vmassol - (16:05): but maybe you're righ  
vmassol - (16:05): right  
vmassol - (16:05): and maybe it's enough to:  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:05): Well the dev list gets sent far and wide over the internet. I think it should be okay to give a lecture "what you see here, what you hear here..."  
vmassol - (16:06): - not provide archives for it  
vmassol - (16:06): - you need to be registered to receive mails for that list  
vmassol - (16:06): we'd still need to not make registration automatic probably  
vmassol - (16:07): otherwise tools like nabble or gmane can susbscribe to it… ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:07): Yes. Another issue is if we make the address public, we're going to be hearing from the British lottery.  
xipe - (16:08): Actually I could be interested in being part of the sec. ML, but it's your choice, if you think that's not a good thing, it's ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:08): But there needs to be a public address for this stuff. +1 xipe.  
vmassol - (16:08): xipe: I think it's a good idea that you are subscribed to it  
vmassol - (16:08): +1 for public address  
vmassol - (16:08): we just ignore mails sent to it for non registered users  
vmassol - (16:09): s/for/from/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:09): Actually we could filter mail with bad headers. I do that locally.  
vmassol - (16:09): xipe: wdyt about the rule: anyone can get access to it, you just need to send a mail to the dev list to ask access to it?  
vmassol - (16:10): (this means the person will need to be subscribed to the devs list first which is already a good barrier)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:10): And if you look shady we reserve the right to do a vote?  
abusenius - (16:11): IMO since there will not be that many interested people, we can put everyone through a vote  
vmassol - (16:12): I don't really see the point of a vote to be honest  
vmassol - (16:12): but why not  
vmassol - (16:12): I'm not sure how I would vote  
abusenius - (16:12): at least there should be some people who say "ok" and time for others to say "I know him, he is bad"  
vmassol - (16:13): abusenius: that can always happen, no need for a vote for that  
xipe - (16:13): I think it's a good rule vmassol. The only thing is that if we do not do "full disclosure" (As in saying we fixed a sec bug when we fixed it, not only saying "some bugfixes"), it can be counter productive.  
vmassol - (16:13): xipe: I think we agree about full disclosure after we fixed a bug  
xipe - (16:13): ok  
vmassol - (16:13): although I don't recall a vote for that so we should make it official  
vmassol - (16:14): abusenius: you want to handle that?  
vmassol - (16:14): (make a proposal for the security strategy on the devs list)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:15): re full disclosure: A gentleman replied to my disclosure of the sql issue asking if there could be a disclosure mailing list.  
abusenius - (16:15): xipe, this list is only meant to be used for discussion about how to fix security bugs  
vmassol - (16:15): (and then put it in writing on dev.xwiki.org)  
vmassol - (16:15): (same as what apache tomcat does)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:16): MediaWiki has a disclosure mailing list, maybe we should think about that as well.  
abusenius - (16:16): vmassol, I think voting in almost the same way as for software  
vmassol - (16:16): http://tomcat.apache.org/security.html and http://tomcat.apache.org/security-5.html  
vmassol - (16:16): abusenius: sure, it's just that I need to know the rule for accepting somewhere and I need to know that person, otherwise I'll just vote +0  
xipe - (16:16): abusenius: yes, but if we discuss it on a not so public, but accepting members ML, it's like disclosing  
abusenius - (16:17): xipe, not much disclosing, those people usually allready know about it  
vmassol - (16:18): abusenius: depends… with our rule of just having to ask anyone could be there  
xipe - (16:18): yes, but my point was that's it open to public even if not public ... anyway, we already agreed so it's ok :)  
vmassol - (16:18): if I'm installing XE for my company, I'd subscribe to that list  
vmassol - (16:18): just to monitor sec issues  
abusenius - (16:19): mm, no this is not an announcment list  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:19): I was about to say that (re admins.)  
abusenius - (16:20): it is for discussions, thats why its private  
vmassol - (16:20): abusenius: so the rule we defined doesn't work  
vmassol - (16:20): we need a different rule  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:20): I'd like to see an announcement list for admins since we seem to agree on disclosure of fixed bugs.  
abusenius - (16:20): we should also have an announcement mailing list, but later imo  
vmassol - (16:20): re ann mailing list  
vmassol - (16:21): yes good idea, we can also put known issues on the site for now  
vmassol - (16:21): so what is the rule abusenius for being allowed to be on that sec mailing list?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:21): If sysops ask for access to the sec discussion list we should have some place to direct them.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 16:21  
vmassol - (16:21): I feel a vote doesn't answer that  
vmassol - (16:22): since as a committer I need to know the rule before Ic an vote  
vmassol - (16:22): !!  
abusenius - (16:22): vmassol, being trusted by committers not to spread information about security vulnerabilities before they are fixed  
xipe - (16:22): vmassol: I think the rules still works, as admins could have important opinions about how to fix sec bugs  
vmassol - (16:22): xipe: personally I'd be to open it to everyone who ask on the dev list  
vmassol - (16:22): but abusenius seems to think it's not ok  
vmassol - (16:23): abusenius: that's your position right?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:23): Interesting point (xipe) maybe it would be a problem that one admin sees it, emails it to another, pretty soon the whole world knows.  
abusenius - (16:23): yes, if we allow anyone there, whats the point of having it?  
vmassol - (16:23): it's a filter  
vmassol - (16:23): a first level filter  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:23): It will always be better than dev because dev is archived all over the internet.  
abusenius - (16:24): a very weak one, anyone could easily pretend interest and produce exploits for every fresh vulnerability  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:25): Easier than reading the templates? ;)  
xipe - (16:25): :)  
vmassol - (16:25): abusenius: indeed  
abusenius - (16:25): it is a list on which we should be able to safely explain in great details how to break into xwiki.org  
abusenius - (16:25): without being hacked :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:26): How much do you trust the mail servers, dns etc.  
vmassol - (16:26): ok then only committers + vote sounds good  
vmassol - (16:26): re the vote we need to explain some conditions  
xipe - (16:26): anyway if you want to write an exploit it's easy : just compare SVN with jira and you get all the patches for security related bugs  
vmassol - (16:26): - active contributor could be one such condition  
xipe - (16:26): that's just as easy as being known on dev@ and ask for being on the sec ML  
vmassol - (16:26): xipe: shhhhhhhhh  
abusenius - (16:26): CalebJamesDeLisl, well lets not be paranoid  
vmassol - (16:26): don't say it here  
abusenius - (16:27): xipe, true, but a committ allready fixes the bug  
xipe - (16:27): yes, sorry vmassol  
xipe - (16:27): abusenius: ok but commit != release  
xipe - (16:27): so no one upgrade on each commit  
abusenius - (16:28): yes, but still less time, and a release should happen quickly abter  
abusenius - (16:28): \*after  
xipe - (16:28): I don't think it's a big diffence anyway  
abusenius - (16:28): well, it is, might be weeks or more  
xipe - (16:29): ok, but might be weeks to between commit and release  
abusenius - (16:29): 2x less time ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:29): Also before we get too worried about spies infiltrating the list we have to consider the number of other insecure webapps, you don't have to outrun the tiger, just the other guy.  
abusenius - (16:30): indeed  
xipe - (16:30): I really think we are being too paranoid on something that doesn't worth it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:31): IMO anyone who has submitted at least one patch or reported at least one new security issue deserves to be on the list if they want.  
xipe - (16:31): anyway between the bugfix, the release and the upgrade there will be monthes  
abusenius - (16:31): xipe, this actually is a common practice  
xipe - (16:31): No, it's a common practice to be paranoid if it's worth it :)  
xipe - (16:32): I think the dev@ + vote filter is enough  
xipe - (16:32): it's so easy to get infos on vuln before release anyway  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:33): MS is the most security paranoid company in existence, they don't publish any source, they don't ever admit security bugs and still they get broken constantly.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:34): My main concern about paranoia is that we hurt the community be separating the "in crowd" from the "out crowd".  
abusenius - (16:35): we dont, we separate honest people from script kiddies  
xipe - (16:35): I think that the more "concerned" people on the list, the better it is, as they could come up with interesting ideas too.

xipe - (16:36): and script kiddies just use exploits and do not tries to infiltrate to kind of "second level" mls imo

abusenius - (16:36): s/script kiddies/unexpirienced hackers/

xipe - (16:37): well, someone taking time infiltrating MLs etc ... will not just write expoits for free

xipe - (16:37): and you will never know if someone in the committers wil not sell exploits

xipe - (16:41): ok
